Comments_List: More speaking skills with spanish and grammar application
Learned to better speak, read, write, and comprehend Spanish
I learned more Spanish vocabulary and grammar and gained more fluency with the language.
I learned the past and subjunctive tenses for Spanish along with more vocabulary. I felt that by the end of the semester I was able to reasonably hold a introductory level conversation.
I have gone from intro-level Spanish to a good enough skill level that I could carry a conversation!
I greatly expanded on my Spanish speaking skills in this class.
Better for oral speaking of spanish and incorporating more verb tenses that were previously taught
Strengths: lots of oral practice in class because only spoke in Spanish
The communication activities and choices of literature can be improved.
I think the course does a good job of including written passages with listen and oral practice.

Strengths: Professors and syllabus organization

Weaknesses: Workload prevented me from engaging in my other classes
I thought the class could have been more explicit on what was being tested.
Yes to fulfill a requirement, there is a significant amount of homework every night and necessary to put in the work in order to get a good grade. Take this class with friends
Only if they have a crazy amount of time to devote to this class.
Yes uf they want to improve from basic to intermediate Spanish level.
Yes. Obviously many people will take it as a required course, but if you are interested in learning another language then L1/L2 sequence is not terribly difficult and definitely enjoyable.
Yes!! Great way to learn a lot of Spanish
